# Resources

Other sources of guidance for reproducibility:


[Research Software: Designing for Publication and Reproducibility](https://guides.nyu.edu/software-reproducibility) from NYU libraries

[Ten simple rules for implementing open and reproducible research practices after attending a training course](https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1010750), PLOS Computational Biology, 2003 https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1010750

- [Appendix D. Reproducible analysis and workflow](https://mdsr-book.github.io/mdsr2e/ch-reproduce.html) from [Modern Data Science with R, 2nd ed](https://mdsr-book.github.io/mdsr2e/), Benjamin S. Baumer, Daniel T. Kaplan, and Nicholas J. Horton, 2023

[Happy Git and GitHub for the useR](https://happygitwithr.com), Jenny Bryan

[The FAIR Data Principles](https://force11.org/info/the-fair-data-principles/)
